poem:
**Negotiations at Dawn**

The morning light spills
over boundaries once rigid,
now tender as parchment.
Naivety crumbles—
paper thin promises
flutter in Brussels' breeze.
Flexibility stretches
across the Channel,
a bridge of intentions,
roots tangled in uncertainty.
We are nations, but at dawn,
just pen and ink,
learning to write anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK must stop being naive over resetting relations with EU, thinktank says The UK must stop being “naive” about negotiations to reset relations with the EU and show more flexibility in its approach to Brussels, a trade policy thinktank has said. As EU leaders question how much has changed in the UK despite the new government, the European Centre for International Political Economy (ECIPE) has outlined a plan to bring the two sides closer after". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
